com.newmainsoftech.spray.sprex.web.servlet.config

Class ViewResolverConfig.SupportingMediaType

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.newmainsoftech.spray.sprex.web.servlet.config.ViewResolverConfig.SupportingMediaType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ViewResolverConfigCase.SupportingMediaTypeCase
    Enclosing class:
    ViewResolverConfig

    @Configuration
public static class ViewResolverConfig.SupportingMediaType
extends Object
implements ViewResolverConfigCase.SupportingMediaTypeCase
    Holder of Media types what ViewResolverConfig supports.
    This class is just for avoiding failure in instantiating ViewResolverConfig bean by circular reference with ViewResolverConfig.contentNegotiationManager in app's configuring ContentNegotiationManager object.
    The autowiring order of ViewResolverConfig and SupportingMediaType somewhat important: SupportingMediaType must be autowired ahead in your code of @Configuration implementation class. Otherwise, NullPointerException may be thrown in autowiring ViewResolverConfig.mvcContentNegotiationManager.
    Author:
    Arata.Y

    • Method Detail

      • getMediaTypes

        public Map<String,org.springframework.http.MediaType> getMediaTypes()
        Description copied from interface: ViewResolverConfigCase.SupportingMediaTypeCase
        This method is to let the @Configuration implementation with this interface have ability to add supporting media types to ContentNegotiationConfigurer.
        So that, this may help to concentrate view related configuration to the @Configuration implementation with this interface.
        In order to let the @Configuration implementation with this interface has the ability, such @Configuration implementation needs to be imported to sub-class of WebMvcConfigurationSupport, and this method must be call (directly or indirectly) at inside of overridden configureContentNegotiation method of that sub-class.
        Specified by:
        getMediaTypes in interface ViewResolverConfigCase.SupportingMediaTypeCase
        Returns:
        map object for the pair of file extension as key and media type as value.

      • getMediaTypeParameterName

        public String getMediaTypeParameterName()
        Specified by:
        getMediaTypeParameterName in interface ViewResolverConfigCase.SupportingMediaTypeCase
        Returns:
        Parameter name being given to ContentNegotiationConfigurer.parameterName(String) method.
